lines.text: Share
You can quickly share a link to a PDF document with others for viewing or commenting. The

spans.text: You can quickly share a link to a PDF document with others for viewing or commenting. The

lines.text: document shared as a link opens in any browser on any device. The document is stored

lines.text: securely in Adobe cloud storage. Recipients get an email with a link, and they can click the

spans.text: securely in Adobe cloud storage. Recipients get an email with a link, and they can click the

lines.text: link to view and comment on the document in a browser; no sign-in is required.

Mark up text
You can use markup tools to give suggestions for formatting the text, structuring a document,

lines.text: or for providing other edit suggestions. Markups and comments don’t change the actual text

comment

lines.text: Using Select Text Tool
1. Open a PDF.
2. Use the Select text tool to select the text you want to mark up.

lines.text: 3. From the markup toolbar that appears, take one of the following actions as desired:

Reviewer experience
The reviewers receive an email invitation with a link to the review PDF. When they select the

spans.text: The reviewers receive an email invitation with a link to the review PDF. When they select the

lines.text: link or the Open button in the invitation, the PDF opens in a web browser. They can use the

spans.text: button in the invitation, the PDF opens in a web browser. They can use the

lines.text: commenting tools to add comments to the PDF. They can also use Acrobat Reader or

spans.text: commenting tools to add comments to the PDF. They can also use Acrobat Reader or

lines.text: Acrobat desktop applications to add comments.

spans.text: Acrobat desktop applications to add comments.

lines.text: Send personalized invitations for commenting
1. Open the PDF in Acrobat.
2. Select Share .
Note:
The computer must be connected to the Internet to start a shared review in Acrobat.

spans.text: The computer must be connected to the Internet to start a shared review in Acrobat.

lines.text: You can also start a shared review directly from other applications that use PDFMaker,

spans.text: You can also start a shared review directly from other applications that use PDFMaker,

lines.text: such as Microsoft Word. Choose Acrobat > Create And Send For Review .
3. Enter the email addresses of the recipients or choose from the Address Book.

spans.text: Enter the email addresses of the recipients or choose from the Address Book.

lines.text: 4. Enter a message to the recipients (optional).

spans.text: Enter a message to the recipients (optional).

lines.text: Hosting a shared review on SharePoint or Office 365

spans.text: Hosting a shared review on SharePoint or Office 365

lines.text: Shared reviews are the most collaborative form of review because participants can read and

spans.text: Shared reviews are the most collaborative form of review because participants can read and

lines.text: reply to the comments of other participants. Comments from participants are stored in a

spans.text: reply to the comments of other participants. Comments from participants are stored in a

lines.text: repository on an internal server. Acrobat synchronizes comments at regular intervals to

spans.text: repository on an internal server. Acrobat synchronizes comments at regular intervals to

lines.text: download all the latest changes. Reviewers are notified of new comments as they are added,

spans.text: download all the latest changes. Reviewers are notified of new comments as they are added,

lines.text: and they can see and reply to comments made by other reviewers.

spans.text: and they can see and reply to comments made by other reviewers.

lines.text: You can use your own internal server location, such as a Microsoft SharePoint

spans.text: You can use your own internal server location, such as a Microsoft SharePoint

lines.text: workspace/subsite, if your recipients work behind a firewall and all have access to a common

spans.text: workspace/subsite, if your recipients work behind a firewall and all have access to a common
